intro: Campanopsis oocarpa, commonly known as the tropical bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Campanopsis oocarpa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
